channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Blocked street lights, 27th October
item.description:
Overgrown trees covering street lighting. This makes this alleyway darker and unsafe at night. In front of Eastbourne Rd. nos 23-25-27.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter on bridge, 27th October
item.description:
The litter and rubbish has not been cleared for week on the bridge here and along the west side. The spaces above the bridge piers are full of leaves and litter. Please clear! Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Battersea Bridge, Battersea, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is this crack that jus happen in our house the stair area, 27th October
item.description:
This just pop out in our house and wanted o report this

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cassland Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Pot hole in the middle of the road, 27th October
item.description:
It is small in diameter but fairly deep so could be dangerous to cyclists. It is also in the middle of the road so you have to swerve to avoid it. I think it may be a pothole that has previously been filled that has opened up again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Salisbury Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Speed bump needs repair outside 154 Forest Hill Road, 27th October
item.description:
Cars thunder over it and scrape front bumpers all night. Lorries and buses make the house shake. Looks like repairs were planned but not carried out.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Forest Hill Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: E8 4NS - Multiple items of hard rubbish dumped, 27th October
item.description:
There are three large mattresses, a desk and a couch that have been dumped on the street and in the driveway and have been there for a week. Please help to collect it asap

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brownlow Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Opposite 113 - 115 frinsted Road, 27th October
item.description:
There is a flag right at the top of the lamppost which as it is swaying in the wind it is making the light shine and flicker into properties. It appears to be like a light house. Please can this be looked into asap
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frinsted Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bins, 27th October
item.description:
Always overflowing. Dirty, smelly, attracting pests, blocks entrance to property and noise disturbance at night. Move bins outside non residential properties?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Haberdasher Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bike blocking pavement, 27th October
item.description:
Lime hire bike(s) blocking pavement or dropped kerb. Hazard for pedestrians, wheelchair users and prams. Please remove and monitor area for repeat dumping.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Centurion Close, Barnsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven paving stones, 27th October
item.description:
My husband who uses a walking stick and knee brace tripped and fell on an uneven paving slab today. We live in Marlborough Park Avenue so it is a road we have to use all the time. He is in considerable pain.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marlborough Park Avenue, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Commercial waste continues to be dumped inside domestic waste bins from K & K Groceries, 27th October
item.description:
Bins are consistently overflowing due to a business next to Halcyon House using domestic waste bins. This results in an unsightly appearance, litter on the floor and pests such as cockroaches entering the building. Please can conversations be had with K & K about them having commercial waste bins and disposal? This has continuously been marked as "fixed" but nothing has been addressed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-5, Walworth Place, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping next to bridge, 27th October
item.description:
Yet more flytipped rubbish next to the railway bridge. Looks like multiple black sacks of garden waste this time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor tarmac surface outside of 79 Sherwood Park Avenue which is not joined properly , and needs to be repaired and re-tarmacked., 27th October
item.description:
Poor tarmac surface outside of 79 Sherwood Park Avenue which is not joined properly , and needs to be repaired and re-tarmacked- there are plants and grass growing out of the tarmac. This issue has previously been reported but has no yet been actioned, and resident reporting this is concerned about this being a trip hazard to elderly residents and school children as there is a bus stop and school close by. Resident also witnessed an elderly man falling and injuring himself due to this- please can this be looked into and repaired ASAP.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 79, Sherwood Park Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet
